question_text:
Write an equation that says that the length of the green line is equal to the length of the black line.
_
backend_description: Shows two line segments: a green line labeled '21' at the top, and below it a black line divided into two parts labeled 'c' and '6'. The visual representation helps students understand that c + 6 = 21.
solution_image_tag: Shows the equation template with boxes to fill in: 'length of green line = length of black line'. This helps students set up the equation based on the visual representation.
Shows the completed equation: the green line length (21) equals the black line length (c + 6), giving the equation 21 = c + 6 or c + 6 = 21.
solution: We want to replace both sides of the equation below with numbers and variable expressions.
The length of the green line is 21.
Putting these together gives c + 6 = 21.
